There's a special irony when Google CEO Eric Schmidt suggests-as he did in a speech to the Council on Foreign Relations last November-that China's government will find it impossible to censor a billion phones that are trying to express themselves. Eric Schmidt is rich because his company sells precisely targeted ads against hundreds of millions of search requests per day. If Google can zero in like that, so can China's censors. While Eric Schmidt will step down as CEO he will assume the role of executive chairman, focusing on deals, partnerships and broader business relationships, as well as advising Page and co-founder Sergey Brin . We've been talking about how best to simplify our management structure and speed up decision making for a long time, Eric Schmidt said.
